intro: Pseudolinosyris capusii var. microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed pseudolinosyris, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its small, rounded flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and the leaves are finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecosystem.
